name: Hawa Mahal

address: K.B. Jacob Rd, Fort Kochi, Kochi, Kerala 682001

address: Hampi, Karnataka 583239

name: Tarakeswar Temple
description: Tarakeswar Temple is one of the most revered Shiva temples in West Bengal, dedicated to Lord Taraknath (Shiva). This ancient temple attracts millions of devotees annually, especially during the holy month of Shravan. The temple is famous for its spiritual significance and the belief that prayers here fulfill devotees' wishes.
prasad: Panchamrita, Bel leaves, Sacred ash (Vibhuti), Kheer, Fruits

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (65 km)

specialFeatures: Ancient Shiva Lingam believed to be self-manifested
Architectural blend of Bengali and Mughal styles
Sacred pond (Tarakeswar Dighi) for holy bath
Annual Gajan festival with traditional rituals
Library with religious texts and scriptures

name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
description: Dakshineswar Kali Temple is a magnificent temple complex dedicated to Goddess Kali, built by Rani Rashmoni in 1855. This temple gained worldwide fame as the place where Sri Ramakrishna Paramahamsa served as a priest and had his divine visions. The temple complex includes the main Kali temple and twelve Shiva temples.

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (25 km)

specialFeatures: Sri Ramakrishna's room preserved as museum
Twelve Shiva temples in temple complex

name: Kalighat Kali Temple
description: Kalighat Kali Temple is one of the 51 Shakti Peethas and the most famous Kali temple in Kolkata. According to legend, the toes of Goddess Sati's right foot fell here. The temple is over 200 years old and attracts thousands of devotees daily who come to seek blessings from Goddess Kali.
prasad: Kheer, Luchi, Alur Dom, Sweets, Fruits

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (8 km)

specialFeatures: Ancient black stone idol of Goddess Kali

name: Tarapith Temple
description: Tarapith Temple is a famous Shakti Peetha dedicated to Goddess Tara, located in Birbhum district. This temple is renowned for Tantric practices and is associated with the famous saint Bamakhepa. The temple attracts devotees seeking spiritual powers and blessings from the fierce form of Goddess Tara.
prasad: Rice, Fish curry, Sweets, Fruits, Sacred ash

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (235 km)

name: Belur Math
description: Belur Math is the headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission, founded by Swami Vivekananda in 1897. This spiritual center combines the architectural features of a church, mosque, and temple, symbolizing the unity of all religions. It houses the temple of Sri Ramakrishna and serves as a major pilgrimage site.
prasad: Prasad from Sri Ramakrishna Temple, Fruits, Sweets

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (22 km)

name: ISKCON Mayapur
description: ISKCON Mayapur is the world headquarters of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, located at the birthplace of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. This magnificent temple complex is dedicated to Lord Krishna and promotes the teachings of Bhakti Yoga. The temple is famous for its spiritual atmosphere and grand festivals.
prasad: Krishna Prasadam, Vegetarian meals, Sweets, Fruits

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (130 km)

name: Jairambati Temple
description: Jairambati Temple is located at the birthplace of Sri Sarada Devi, the Holy Mother and spiritual consort of Sri Ramakrishna. This sacred place attracts devotees who come to pay homage to the Divine Mother. The temple complex includes the ancestral home of Sarada Devi and various shrines dedicated to her memory.

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (180 km)

name: St. Paul's Cathedral
description: St. Paul's Cathedral is the Anglican cathedral of Kolkata and the first episcopal church in Asia. Built in Indo-Gothic style, this magnificent cathedral was consecrated in 1847. The cathedral features beautiful stained glass windows, impressive architecture, and serves as an important center for Christian worship in Eastern India.
timings: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM (Daily), Sunday Service: 8:30 AM & 6:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (8 km)

name: Bandel Church
description: Bandel Church, officially known as the Basilica of the Holy Rosary, is one of the oldest churches in India, built by Portuguese missionaries in 1599. This historic church is dedicated to Our Lady of the Rosary and attracts thousands of pilgrims annually. The church showcases Portuguese colonial architecture and houses several religious artifacts.
timings: 6:00 AM - 7:00 PM (Daily), Sunday Mass: 7:00 AM, 9:00 AM, 6:00 PM
festivals: Feast of Our Lady of the Rosary (October)

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (55 km)

specialFeatures: One of oldest churches in India

name: St. John's Church
description: St. John's Church is one of the oldest churches in Kolkata, built in 1787. Located in the heart of the city near the GPO, this Anglican church is known for its neoclassical architecture and historical significance. The church houses the tomb of Job Charnock, the founder of Calcutta, and several other British colonial figures.
timings: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Daily), Sunday Service: 8:30 AM & 6:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (10 km)

specialFeatures: One of oldest churches in Kolkata

name: Sacred Heart Church
description: Sacred Heart Church is a prominent Catholic church located in the heart of Kolkata. Built in the early 20th century, this church is known for its beautiful Gothic Revival architecture and serves a large Catholic community. The church is famous for its devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus and hosts regular masses and religious activities.
timings: 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM (Daily), Sunday Mass: 7:00 AM, 9:00 AM, 11:00 AM, 6:30 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (9 km)

specialFeatures: Devotion to Sacred Heart of Jesus

name: St. Thomas Church
description: St. Thomas Church is a historic Anglican church located on Middleton Street in Kolkata. Built in the 19th century, this church serves the local Christian community and is known for its simple yet elegant architecture. The church is dedicated to St. Thomas the Apostle and maintains traditional Anglican worship practices.
timings: 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM (Daily), Sunday Service: 8:30 AM & 6:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (7 km)

specialFeatures: Dedicated to St. Thomas the Apostle

name: Our Lady of Dolours Church
description: Our Lady of Dolours Church is a Catholic church located in the Sealdah area of Kolkata. This church is dedicated to Our Lady of Sorrows and serves the local Catholic community with regular masses and religious services. The church is known for its devotional atmosphere and community involvement in social activities.
timings: 6:30 AM - 7:30 PM (Daily), Sunday Mass: 7:00 AM, 9:00 AM, 6:00 PM
festivals: Feast of Our Lady of Dolours (September)

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (12 km)

specialFeatures: Dedicated to Our Lady of Sorrows

name: Nakhoda Mosque
description: Nakhoda Mosque is the largest mosque in Kolkata and one of the largest in India. Built in 1926, this magnificent mosque can accommodate over 10,000 worshippers. The mosque is built in the Mughal architectural style with red sandstone and features beautiful minarets, domes, and intricate carvings.

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (12 km)

name: Tipu Sultan Mosque
description: Tipu Sultan Mosque is a historic mosque located in the heart of Kolkata, built in 1832. Named after the famous ruler Tipu Sultan of Mysore, this mosque showcases Indo-Islamic architecture and serves the Muslim community in central Kolkata. The mosque is known for its beautiful design and historical significance.

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (9 km)

name: Adina Mosque
description: The Adina Mosque, located in Pandua, Malda, West Bengal, is a historic royal mosque built during the Bengal Sultanate. It was once the largest mosque in the Indian subcontinent and is now a preserved monument. Constructed in 1373–1375 by Sikandar Shah, the mosque reflects the imperial aspirations of the Ilyas Shahi dynasty after its victories over the Delhi Sultanate.

nearestTransport.airport: Bagdogra Airport (200 km)

name: Baro Shona Masjid
description: The Baro Shona Masjid (Great Golden Mosque), also known as the Baroduari Masjid (12-Gated Mosque), is a historic Indo-Islamic monument in Gour, Malda. Built in 1526 CE by Nasiruddin Nasrat Shah, it is the largest monument in Gour. The mosque was originally decorated with glazed colored tile mosaics and had 44 gilded domes.

nearestTransport.airport: Bagdogra Airport (200 km)

name: Choto Sona Masjid
description: Choto Sona Masjid, also known as the "Small Golden Mosque," was built during the reign of Sultan Alauddin Husain Shah (1493–1519). This mosque is famous for its intricate stone carvings and once had gilded domes, giving it the name "Sona" (gold). It represents the finest example of Bengali Islamic architecture.

nearestTransport.airport: Bagdogra Airport (205 km)

specialFeatures: Built during Alauddin Husain Shah era

name: Katra Mosque
description: Katra Mosque was constructed between 1723 and 1724 by Nawab Murshid Quli Khan, the first Nawab of Bengal. This mosque also houses his tomb and is one of the oldest and most historically significant mosques in West Bengal. The mosque represents the architectural style of the Nawabi period.

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (220 km)

specialFeatures: Built by Nawab Murshid Quli Khan (1723-24)

name: Furfura Sharif Mosque
description: Furfura Sharif Mosque was established in 1375 and gained prominence under Hazrat Abu Bakr Siddique in the 19th century. It is a significant pilgrimage site, especially during the annual Urs festival. The mosque and shrine complex represents the Sufi tradition in Bengal.
timings: 5:00 AM - 10:00 PM (Daily), Special timings during Urs

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (80 km)

name: Gurudwara Bari Sangat
description: Gurudwara Bari Sangat is one of the oldest and most prominent Sikh temples in Kolkata, located in the historic Burrabazar area. This gurudwara serves the Sikh community and welcomes people of all faiths. It is known for its langar (community kitchen), religious services, and cultural activities that promote Sikh values and traditions.
timings: 4:00 AM - 10:00 PM (Daily), Morning Prayer: 5:00 AM, Evening Prayer: 7:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (12 km)

name: Gurudwara Guru Nanak Darbar
description: Gurudwara Guru Nanak Darbar is a significant Sikh temple dedicated to Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism. Located in central Kolkata, this gurudwara serves the local Sikh community and promotes the teachings of Guru Nanak. The gurudwara is known for its peaceful atmosphere and regular religious activities.
timings: 5:00 AM - 9:00 PM (Daily), Morning Prayer: 6:00 AM, Evening Prayer: 7:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (12 km)
nearestTransport.bus: Shyama Charan Mukherjee Street Bus Stop (200 meters)

specialFeatures: Dedicated to Guru Nanak Dev Ji

name: Gurudwara Singh Sabha
description: Gurudwara Singh Sabha is an important Sikh temple located on Ripon Street in Kolkata. This gurudwara follows the Singh Sabha movement principles and serves the Sikh community with religious services, educational programs, and social activities. The gurudwara is known for its commitment to Sikh traditions and community service.
timings: 4:30 AM - 9:30 PM (Daily), Morning Prayer: 5:30 AM,Evening Prayer: 7:30 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (8 km)

name: Gurudwara Sri Badi Sangat Sahib
description: Gurdwara Sri Badi Sangat Sahib is a historic Sikh place of worship located in the Barabazar Market area of Kolkata. It holds great significance as it was visited by both Sri Guru Nanak Sahib Ji and Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Sahib Ji during their travels. This gurudwara has been blessed by two Gurus and serves as an important center of Sikh faith.
timings: 4:00 AM - 10:00 PM (Daily), Morning Prayer: 5:00 AM, Evening Prayer: 7:00 PM

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (12 km)

specialFeatures: Visited by Guru Nanak (1510) and Guru Tegh Bahadur (1668)

name: Gurudwara Jagat Sudhar
description: Gurudwara Jagat Sudhar is a Sikh place of worship that embodies the principle of "World's Reform". This gurudwara serves as a center for spiritual discourse, prayer, and community service, following the teachings of Guru Granth Sahib and promoting Sikh values of selfless service, righteousness, and spiritual upliftment.
timings: 4:30 AM - 9:30 PM (Daily), Morning Prayer: 5:30 AM, Evening Prayer: 7:30 PM
amenities: Prayer hall with Guru Granth Sahib

nearestTransport.airport: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport (8 km)
